title: Blackletter ID
content:
I can't place this one...it's a scan off an embroidered cap that I need to recreate, so some of the finer details may not match an existing font, but the general shapes should be recognizable ![KUBlackletter.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628181015im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/4356.jpg)

 [‹ Font ID request!!](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628181015/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6204 "Go to previous forum topic") [Looking for a telephone keypad font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628181015/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6111 "Go to next forum topic")
author: flow14

comments.content: I'll wait for [Butler](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628181015/http:/eccentrifuge.com/Fonts/blackletter.html), the Blackletter master, on this one.

The shapes seem a little on this side of awkward to be a typeface. Engravers Old English or Old English at [myfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628181015/http:/myfonts.com/) are close, but not quite. The 'O' strikes me as being part of another character. But again, Butler might have a match for you.

The letters are actually "K U"   
(as in Kansas University).   
They've been made into a ligature.

you could re-draw it from Engravers Old or Caslon Text Series, same structure for Caps.   
   
that's an o? looked like a u to me. wotever it is its looks bastardized, over and over again. Blackletter's with outlines?

That 'U' would look more like a 'U' (for me anyway) if the final vertical stroke were flopped thus visually leaving more of a 'U' shape.   
   
Just thoughts.
